general.headline: Managing Consultant at Tandem Partners Pty Ltd.

jobs.description:
Tandem Partners was created to offer companies and the HR profession the very best access to HR talent and careers.  Our guiding principles help us to deliver outstanding service that translates into a sustainable positive influence on the Australian HR landscape.
 
As HR Talent Experts, we recruit across all the core HR disciplines from HR Directors through to HR graduates.   The main areas of ongoing demand include HR generalists, HR business partners, HR Managers, remuneration and benefits, employee/industrial relations, learning and development, change management, organisational development, recruitment and resourcing, talent management and mobility.  With offices in Melbourne and Sydney, our reach is national and delivered by a team of professionals with unparalled longevity in the field.
 
We foster and encourage a working environment that’s flexible and team-centric. We are a truly focused team that loves nothing more than to help shape the careers of HR professionals. We’re genuinely excited by our work, and hope that this shines through in each and every one of your interactions with us.
 
In the last year alone we have facilitated career moves for over 300 HR practitioners. 

I specifically focus on mid to senior level permanent appointments in Melbourne

Tailor Executive is an Australian based search and recruitment firm, established in Melbourne. We focus on finding the most exceptional talent at the mid to senior management level, as well as the next generation of business leaders.
 
With wide reaching national networks, we partner with clients and candidates from a broad range of industry sectors including; Financial & Professional Services, FMCG, Retail, Pharmaceutical, Technology, Telecommunications, Transport & Logistics, Engineering, Building & Construction and Government. 

We bring expertise in identifying and placing leading professionals across Melbourne and Sydney with specialist skills in;

general.headline: Chief Executive Telstra InfraCo
general.description:
Leads Telstra InfraCo the newly created infrastructure services arm of Telstra.  

Prior to current role was Group Executive for Telstra Enterprise which delivers connectivity, platforms, applications and tailored industry solutions to enterprise and government customers around the world. With operations in 20 countries, Telstra Enterprise generates more than $8B in revenues.

Joined Telstra in 2011 as Chief Operations Officer (COO) with responsibility for all aspects of Telstra’s operating environment including networks, IT, field services, nbn and network application services.  

Prior to joining Telstra, spent more than 25 years with IBM and held a number of senior executive positions in Europe, Asia and Australia, including the General Manager of Europe and CEO of the United Kingdom and Ireland. 

A member of the boards of Ooyala, Foxtel and Telstra Ventures. 

A member of the West Coast Eagles.

From South West Western Australia and now based in Sydney.

general.headline: Telstra Business Women's Awards 2017 NSW Finalist | Leadership | Continual Improvement
general.description:
Former Chief Financial Officer of Secure Parking, CPA Divisional Council and former Hockeyroo. 

My career story is one of transitioning from elite athlete, to world traveller to well respected leader and CFO. At Secure Parking I led the finance team's evolution and growth since 2003 from a small entrepreneurial family run business valued around $5m to global enterprise which was sold in Jan 2017 to a Japanese publicly listed company for more than $150m. In 2008, with 148 car parks I centralised the Finance team. In 2017, with over 580 car parks finance had the same head count, achieved through my leadership and weekly focus on innovation, technology and continual improvement. 
I apply an energetic and positive lens to everything I do. I have a strategic, pragmatic and commercial approach to building a business and this has been the foundation I have set to grow Secure Parking to the enterprise it is today. My strength is in the development and execution of innovative strategies to deliver continued market share and profit objectives. 
As a leader, I lead my team like a high performing sport team. Ric Charlesworth, Hockeyroos Coach influenced my leadership style in my time with him as a Hockeyroo. I believe a leader’s job is to support their team so they can perform at their best every game/every day. It's not about personal glory, it's about co-ordinating the team to work towards a mutual goal and reminding the team to always think, what I can do better, how can I be more efficient and what can I do for my teammate.
Continual improvement through technology, innovation and efficiency leads to amazing results over time especially when your team is always thinking, what I can do better today that will help me tomorrow.

jobs.description:

As the CFO, I am a key member of the Executive Management team ultimately accountable for all financial aspect of the organisation and influence across all business decisions, processes and strategy. Gross Revenue range $500 Million, including leased and managed. Leadership of 30 FTEs across the region and payroll around 1,000 staff in 3 countries.

general.headline: Diversity & Inclusion Senior Manager | Organisational Development Practitioner | Non-Profit Board Director
general.description:
Ross Wetherbee is Organisational Development Manager, Diversity & Inclusion and Performance within Commonwealth Bank of Australia’s Retail Bank. 

CommBank is Australia’s leading provider of integrated financial services and one of the most recognised brands in the Australian financial industry. The Retail Bank delivers a seamless banking experience to more than 10 million personal and small business customers.

In December 2017 Ross commenced as a Board Director with Wear It Purple, a youth-led non-profit, and in March 2018 was named as the inaugural winner of the Diversity Champion category at the Australian LGBTI Awards, both reflecting his passion for equality. 

Prior to joining CBA in June 2017, Ross was the Senior Program Manager of ACON’s Pride Inclusion Programs (Pride in Diversity & Pride in Sport), leading a team of D&I practitioners delivering advisory, strategy consulting and training services in LGBTI inclusion to over 200 client organisations spanning all industries and sectors across Australia. 

During his time at ACON, Ross was also responsible for the development, launch and operations of Pride in Sport, a tailored initiative to support the inclusion of LGBTI staff, players, volunteers, coaches and spectators in Australian sport, and the Pride in Sport Index (PSI) – Australia’s definitive benchmark for LGBTI inclusion in sport, which, at the National and State Sporting Organisation level, are both world firsts.

Before joining ACON in 2014, Ross spent five years as a Global Talent Consultant at Macquarie Group Limited, and chaired MGL’s LGBTI Employee Network. 

Ross has experience in Generalist HR, Organisational Development & Learning and Diversity & Inclusion across Banking, Insurance & Financial Services and Telecommunications. Ross has a passion for developing engaged, high-performing and inclusive organisational cultures that see individuals, teams and organisations grow. 

You can get in touch with Ross by emailing ross.wetherbee@cba.com.au

jobs.jobTitle: OD Manager, Diversity & Inclusion and Performance
UNITY (LGBTI) Council Member & Employee Network Lead
jobs.description:
'Unity' is CBA’s LGBTI and Ally network and is an inclusive group of over 2,500 professionals across the Bank who aim to foster business, social, and support relationships for CBA's Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Queer and Intersex employees. 

The UNITY Employee Network is comprised of a team of national and international co-leads who are responsible for the execution of the network strategy within their state and/or region in addition to convening local events and activities in support of LGBTI+ inclusion.

Our purpose: To advocate and facilitate a culture of inclusion and respect- regardless of sex, sexuality, gender and expression - to enhance the well-being of our people, customers and communities.

Our goals are:
1. To encourage diversity of thought and opinion;
2. To promote equality at all levels and in all workplaces; and
3. To cultivate a self-sustaining network of community members who pro-actively champion employee engagement, talent retention, and promote awareness and best practice in diversity issues.

Wear it Purple was founded in 2010 in response to global stories of real teenagers, real heartache and their very real responses. In 2010, several rainbow young people took their own lives following bullying and harassment restyling from the lack of acceptance of their sexuality or gender identity.

One member of this group was 18 year old Tyler Clementi who took his own life after being publicly ‘outed’ as gay by his roommate, prompting a frenzy as reports poured in of various young people sadly in the same situation.

In response, Ellen DeGeneres made a statement, that “this needs to be a wake-up call to everyone: teenage bullying and teasing is an epidemic…and the death rate is climbing.”

As the world saw the faces of precious young lives lost, some young people found a new sense of conviction and purpose to ensure that young people everywhere would know that there were people who did support and love them. Wear it Purple was established to show young people across the globe that there was hope, that there were people who did support and accept them, and that they have the right to be proud of who they are.

Since 2010, when Wear it Purple was co-founded by Katherine Hudson and Scott Williams, Wear it Purple has developed into an international movement. New generations of rainbow young people continue to be dedicated to promoting the annual expression of support and acceptance to rainbow young people.

What started out small has now grown; however the message remains the same. Everybody has the right to be proud of who they are.

So join us each year, on August 31 to celebrate Wear it Purple Day. Be part of a movement that has the potential to save thousands of lives. Be part of this change.

general.headline: Owner and CEO at Symmetra
general.description:
Heather began her career in South Africa in 1990, establishing a diversity consultancy to dismantle apartheid in the workplace. She opened the doors of Symmetra in the Asia Pacific region in 2003, specialising in positioning organisations to leverage diversity to optimise business performance and innovation. 

Recognised as an influential thought leader, Heather is called upon regularly to present to C suite clients across the globe. Her multidisciplinary team conducts diagnostics; advises on best practice policy and strategy; and facilitates cutting edge solutions to blue chip clients on every continent, bringing to bear innovative tools, process and content, which Symmetra has built over the last decade. 

Heather was voted a Finalist in the Telstra Business Women of the Year Awards (2011); has been invited to present at international conferences in the USA, Italy, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, India, Hong Kong and Singapore; invited as contributing author on Diversity and Inclusion in Maverick Executive: Strategies for Driving Clarity, Effectiveness and Focus (2016); has been appointed repeatedly as one of 92 global experts on the Panel which ratifies the Global Diversity and Inclusion Benchmark Standards™ (2006, 2011 and 2015); and in 2018, sat on the Judging Panel of the Diversity & Inclusion in Asia Network (DIAN) Decade Awards for Advancing D&I in Asia. All of this is testimony to global recognition of her ability to influence the transformation of workplace cultures into inclusive environments.  

Heather’s work attained international recognition in 2012 when CBA put its entire top leadership through Symmetra’s Unconscious Bias Program and received the Global Catalyst Award for the advancement of women. In July 2016, Symmetra’s Conscious Decision Making Program - designed to counteract the impact of unconscious bias on the quality of everyday business decisions - was a Finalist in the Australian Psychological Society Workplace Excellence Awards.

jobs.description:
Symmetra  is an international Consultancy specialising in the provision of diversity and equity products and services designed to help corporations embed an inclusive workplace culture, attract and retain diverse talent and maximize the value difference can bring to the workplace.

Backed by the successful business and professional track record of its team, Symmetra is well positioned to offer its clients a global perspective on diversity and inclusion issues, provide international benchmarks and ensure that its solutions are designed not only to attract and retain a more diverse workforce, but also to translate better diversity management into an improved bottom-line for the business.

Since Diversity Consulting (now Symmetra) opened its head office in Australia in 2003, its service offerings have been utilised by a wide range of organisations in both the private and public sector in Australia, US, UK, Europe, South Africa, New Zealand and Asia.

general.headline: CEO at Xplore for Success
general.description:
Amanda is an experienced and highly respected business leader and Human Resources practitioner. She has over 25 years of business experience and expertise and has worked across industries including banking & finance, professional services, FMCG, and Management consultancy.

Amanda started her career in commerce with Westpac holding  finance and management roles in Retail and Commercial Banking. She followed her passion for working with people, and transitioned into Human Resources. 

Amanda built her successful senior HR career working withing organisations inclusing Westpac, AMP, SOCOG, and Deloitte. She has deep experience in Organisational Development (OD), Leadership Development, Learning & Development (L&D) and Diversity & Inclusion (D&I). Her strengths include leadership development, talent development, talent management, facilitation and OD strategy. Over the years, Amanda has lead and managed numerous teams and has had the privilege and pleasure of working with many of the industries brightest and most passionate practitioners. 

In recent years, Amanda has worked in management consulting firms where she has combined her consulting, facilitation, and coaching skills with her business development, marketing and commercial management skills.  In October 2011, Amanda launched her very successful HR consultancy, One Degree HR. 

In January 2016, Amanda became the General Manager of Xplore for Success, a consultancy that specialises in Inclusive Leadership, Gender Equality, Executive Coaching and career development.

Energetic,  pragmatic and astute, with a sharp business mind,  Amanda is passionate about working with clients to assist and support them to develop, grow and strive to build their organisations and employees inclusive leadership and people capability.

He is a global business leader with over 20 years’ corporate experience in blue chip organisations, holding leadership positions at a Global, European and Country level. As a consultant, facilitator, executive coach and speaker, his passion is to combine his corporate expertise, helping organizations create a high performing inclusive organisation, that enables diverse talent to thrive and add value to the bottom line.

His wider work in driving LGBT inclusion, has recently received him recognition as one of the top 50 influential LGBT Out Executives in the UK.

jobs.jobTitle: Global Director of Diversity & Inclusion - Microsoft International
jobs.description:
Leading Diversity & Inclusion for Microsoft International.
      

    
      

    Providing overall strategic leadership, partnership and subject matter expertise to
      
      business leaders and HR business partners globally.

We specialise  in Diversity & Inclusion, helping clients across the globe to maximize their greatest asset; their employees. 

You may be looking for support with D&I for any number of reasons – innovation, compliance, access to skills…. We are here to share experience and to define what interventions will make the most sustainable change, regardless of how advanced your organization’s approach to D&I has been up until now. 

We help clients across the globe get the best out of their people by tapping into what makes them unique. We will help you do the same, forming a strong partnership that ensures we are working effectively on those areas of most relevance & value to you. 

We define Diversity in its very broadest sense. Traditional areas of gender, ethnicity & LGBT are very much on the agenda, complemented by other facets such as age or social background. These can all be recognized, valued & managed strategically to give measurable business results & reach true Diversity of Thought. 

Our experience shows that in order to achieve these results and embed them into the fabric of their business, clients must approach Diversity & Inclusion as a culture change program.

general.headline:
Founder & MD Job Capital, Co-Founder Startup.Business, Founder & CEO Inspiring Rare Birds
AFR Women Of Influence 2018
general.description: Jo Burston is one of Australia’s most successful female entrepreneurs. She has launched six businesses, the standout being Job Capital which went from $0 to $40-million turnover in five years and has kept her on the list of Australia’s top 30 female entrepreneurs since 2013. Jo has worked in partnership with the Prime Minister and Cabinet (PM&C) and Office For Women (OFW) as well as global brands such as Microsoft, Google, EY , PwC and XERO. Her most recent launch is www.startup.business which runs entrepreneurial Learning in Action programs for school-aged children both in curriculum and as school holiday programs in every state and territory in Australia. Jo is passionate about the idea that you can’t be what you can’t see and uses these programs, as well as her globally recognised social impact business Inspiring Rare Birds, to inspire, support and educate entrepreneurs with the goal of giving every woman the opportunity to be an entrepreneur by choice.

jobs.description:
Job Capital is a full service Migration Firm with a team of Migration Agents in house. We
      specialize in On-Hire Work Agreement (Labour Agreement), Permanent Residency,
      Employer Nomination Sponsorship, Single Business Sponsorship, Spousal, De Facto and
      
      Student Visas.

At startup.business we take entrepreneurial learning outside the classroom and into business activity. We understand that people don’t want to be taught, they want to learn, and we passionately believe there is no action without learning and no learning without action. 

Our company name, Phronesis Academy, refers to the particular notion of judgment and experience emphasised by Aristotle: ‘practical wisdom.’ It indicates our purpose: to develop participants’ ways of thinking, practical nous, and the notion of the common good. We are not satisfied awarding certificates – we want our graduates to have initiated sophisticated business planning, developed social networks to support their ventures, and to have gathered the know-how and nous to establish and grow respected and sustainable ventures.

Our vision, mission and values align with this understanding – globally we want to see millions of aspiring and emerging entrepreneurs growing themselves and their businesses through learning in action.

Inspiring Rare Birds is a disruptive agent of change, creating real social and economic impact via mentorship, funding, storytelling, community and partnership with individuals and thought leaders whom align with our values and purpose.

general.headline: * CEO Group of 100; * Group General Manager Corporate Affairs Ruralco Holdings; & * Director Woodhill Communication
general.description:
I am a senior corporate affairs professional with extensive experience in government (regulator and Ministerial Staff) and in public (ASX100) and private companies. I have:

• A strong track record in all aspects of stakeholder communication including strategic counsel, media relations, government relations, social media, investor relations, internal communication and issues management as both a consultant and working in-house.

• Experience in working for major corporations, media companies, government, key regulatory agencies, and industry associations/lobby groups.

• Provided high level strategic counsel to senior management from Cabinet Ministers, Departmental Secretaries, Federal and State Government Ministers, Members of Boards and industry leaders of some of Asia Pacific’s largest companies.

• Worked on some of the Asia Pacific’s largest transactions and policy issues including the sale of Optus to SingTel, equity risings, contract wins and industrial disputes.

• Named as one of Australia’s most influential corporate affairs leaders in the Power 50 Survey by Salt & Shein.

I have a Masters Degree in Communication; a Bachelors Degree with majors in Political Science and in Economic History; and until recently was undertaking a PhD in Social Media part time. Due to work pressure I withdrew from the PhD program after three years of study.  I was invited to join the Golden Key Honour Society for academic excellence due to my results in the Masters Degree.

I am a Member of the Asia-Pacific Association of Communication Directors; Public Relations Institute of Australia; Australian Professional Government Relations Association; National Press Club; Australian Marketing Institute; and am a Certified Practising Marketer.

jobs.description:
I work as the CEO of the Group of 100 part time, the organisation is a business/lobby
      group representing the CFOs and senior finance managers of the top publicly listed and
      private companies in Australia, overseas companies working in Australia as well as
      
      Australian government departments and education institutions.

I manage corporate affairs for Ruralco in a part time position responsible for media
      relations, government affairs, internal communication, financial communication and
      
      crisis communication.

I am the Founder and Director of Woodhill Communication, a boutique corporate affairs agency specialising in strategic and stakeholder communication, particularly in the areas of media relations, government affairs, crisis communication and internal communication.  I am working for clients in the bio-medical, agri-business, manufacturing and services sectors.

Metcash is listed on the Australian Stock Exchange and is an ASX100 listed stock; it owns premium retail brands including IGA, Mitre 10, Cellarbrations and AutObarn amongst others.  I managed the key communication functions: Media Relations (retail and trade media as well as Press Gallery); Investor Relations (buy and sell side); Government Relations (Federal and State); Internal Communication (office and warehouse workers); and Corporate Social Media.  I joined the company to establish the corporate affairs function and bring together the key stakeholder communication groups.  I introduced ‘proactive’ stakeholder communication, and worked on campaigns such as the introduction of an Effects test into competition legislation, trading hours and ending the excessive discounting through petrol shopper dockets impacting independent retailers.

• Financial Services Council (short term contract)
The Council is the industry/lobby group representing leading investment fund managers, pension schemes, retail superannuation funds & life insurance companies. I joined the organisation to assist rebrand it and raise the profile of the CEO. Key achievements included setting up an industry wide issues management group amongst Corporate Affairs Manages of member companies to exchange ideas as well as introducing ‘swamp’ campaigns.  This enabled 20 voices to be heard on an issue rather than just the industry body allowing the retail superannuation sector to match the industry superannuation funds’ share of voice for the first time.  This was a critical aspect of the campaigns against Government proposals to change superannuation entitlements.

• Australian Securities & Investments Commission (ASIC) (two year contract)
ASIC is Australia’s corporate, markets and financial services regulator.  I joined ASIC on a two year contract to reform the way the regulator approached communication.  After restructuring the communication functions I embarked on a ‘proactive’ system of briefing key business media without compromising investigations, something that had not been allowed in the past.  The focus was business media, the Press Gallery, Government Ministers and staff as well as bureaucrats.  This included preparations for, and management of, appearances before Senate estimates & Joint Parliamentary Committees.

• Kreab Gavin Anderson (short term contract)
Gavin Anderson is a leading corporate affairs/public relations consultancy.  The organisation carries out financial communication, public relations, marketing communication and issues management for some of Australia’s largest companies and key industry groups across a variety of industry sectors.  I joined this company on a short term contract basis to assist their Financial Corporate Affairs team which I subsequently lead.  I was offered a long term contract but declined.

jobs.jobTitle: Director of Corporate Affairs, Marketing and Publicity
jobs.description: The Nine Network is one of five free to air national television networks.  It employs staff around Australia broadcasting to all capital cities and has close links with regional affiliates in each of the Australian States and Territories.  In this position I managed all Corporate Affairs, Marketing and Publicity for the television network, ensuring Channel Nine received positive promotion of programs in print, online and broadcast media.  I also managed the Network’s sponsorships and advertising.  One of nine Directors, I left the company with the others soon after private equity purchased it.

Transfield Services is an operations, maintenance and construction services business, operating globally in the resources, energy, industrial, infrastructure, property and defence sectors.  I was employed to establish the communication function ensuring more positive business media coverage and to introduce an internal communication function.  I was able to use Corporate Affairs to assist win services contracts.  I left the company following an offer from the former Optus CEO (then PBL Deputy Executive Chairman) to go to Channel Nine.

I spent over five years at Optus heading up Corporate Affairs with responsibility for media relations (telco media, press gallery and trade media) and internal communication (for both office workers and technicians).  The company faced many issues whist I was there including the takeover by SingTel, an aborted hostile takeover of AAPT, major cable cuts (bringing down the ASX and other major companies) and major injuries on worksites.  I was able to use corporate affairs to assist winning contracts.  We were able to ensure a ‘proactive’ approach to media relations and ‘live’ CEO broadcasts to staff ensuring they were up to date with company issues and approaches.

jobs.jobTitle: Asst Director Corporate Affairs (Head of Function)
jobs.description: One of the leading lobby/industry groups in Australia, the Minerals Council represents the biggest mining companies in the world.  I was employed to manage all corporate/industry-wide media relations for the mining industry which included industry business media, trade media and the Press Gallery.  The team I managed was also responsible for producing an industry/member publication ensuring member companies stayed in touch with MCA activities.  I ran the media and advertising for the high profile campaigns on Native Title MkII (working with indigenous groups); diesel fuel rebate for mining companies.  I established the Corporate Affairs/Issues Management mining industry think-tank for all member company heads of communication

Earlier positions I have held include:

• Head of Marketing & Corporate Affairs for the Australian Taxation Office;

• Senior Corporate Affairs Manager for the Civil Aviation Authority (now AirServices Australia); and

• Press Secretary to the Hon John Fahey when he was Minister for Industrial Relations and Further Education in New South Wales.

general.headline: Research Director at Diversity Council Australia
general.description: In her role as Research Director, Jane O’Leary oversees DCA’s mission to generate leading diversity research, thinking and practice in the Australian context. Jane works in partnership with leading diversity thinkers and practitioners in business and academia to conceive of, design and implement innovative research projects, which influence progress and the broader public debate in diversity management and equity. Jane has a PhD through The University of Queensland Business School and a Master of Education degree through Queensland University of Technology. Her research investigated diversity and inclusion.

jobs.description:
Jane O'Leary provides a range of research, advisory and consulting services to assist Australian employers drive business improvement through successful diversity management. 

In 2008 she took on the role of Research Director to oversee DCA’s mission to work in partnership with members to generate ground breaking diversity research that enables Australian organisations to fully leverage the benefits of a diverse talent pool. 

Since then, Jane has worked with leading diversity thinkers and practitioners in business and academia to conceive of, design and implement innovative research projects, which enable Australian organisations to re-imagine and reconfigure the way they manage talent in today’s dynamic operating environments. 

She has established DCA's research function and worked with Australia's leading diversity employers to design and deliver diversity research which is ahead of the curve, speaks to the Australian context, drives business improvement and, importantly, leads public debate.

Her areas of specialisation include managerial diversity capability, diversity strategy development, implementation and evaluation, women in the workplace, and learning and development.

Jane has a PhD, which investigated how Australian managers can most effectively manage workforce diversity. She was awarded a federal government scholarship to undertaken this research at the University of Queensland Business School. The findings have been well received both here in Australia and overseas, with the Australian and New Zealand Academy of Management presenting her with an award at its 2010 conference. Jane also has a Masters of Education degree undertaken through the Queensland University of Technology. Her study focussed on the area of women in leadership, and she was awarded an Academic Prize for Outstanding Achievement. She has published papers on workforce diversity, women and leadership, qualitative research, and learning and development.

jobs.companyName: Equal Opportunity for Women in the Workplace Agency
jobs.description:
Prior to joining DCA, Jane worked in the Equal Opportunity for Women in the Workplace Agency (EOWA) consulting to employers on issues relating to diversity and inclusion. 

She held EOWA's most senior policy role during the review of the (former) Affirmative Action Act and during the implementation of the amended Act - the EOWW Act (1999). She had responsibility for working with EOWA Advisory Board, the Minister's Office & the Department of Workplace Relations & Small Business to develop the policy framework for interpreting and administering the amended Act and overseeing the development of accompanying compliance and waiving educational guidelines for employers. 

On the basis of her work in this role she was awarded a Medal for Significant Contribution to the Australian Public Service in 2001.

jobs.description:
Monash University is committed to delivering a world-class student learning experience. To achieve such a goal in an increasingly competitive global market, we must challenge our teaching practice.
Through the Better Teaching, Better Learning Agenda, Monash is addressing this challenge by developing innovative and outward looking courses that are student centred in their approach, while
also demonstrating a global perspective. Training and mentoring initiatives which support educators in their responses to the changing needs of students are being offered by the Monash Education Academy.

The Department leads the delivery of education and development services to children, young people and adults both directly through government schools and indirectly through the regulation and funding of early childhood services, non-government schools and training programs.

The Department implements Victorian Government policy on early childhood services, school education and training and higher education services. The Department manages Victorian government schools and drives improvement in primary and secondary government education.

The Australian Synchrotron is a national research facility that uses accelerator technology to produce a powerful source of light – x-rays and infrared radiation – a million times brighter than the sun.

The facility has nine different experimental stations, or beamlines, which harness that light so researchers can see the fundamental structure and composition of materials, on scales ranging from the atomic to the macroscopic – with a level of detail, speed and accuracy not possible in conventional laboratories.

The Australian Synchrotron supports a broad range of high quality research, with applications in sectors from medicine and nanotechnology to manufacturing and mineral exploration. Our highly advanced techniques and passionate staff are contributing directly and demonstrably to scientific advances and industrial innovations with medical, social and economic benefits for all Australians.

general.headline: Helping Organisations Unlock Value Of Their People Through Collaboration & Learning At Work
general.description:
Hello my name is Helen Blunden and I help people ACTIVATE the way they learn, connect and collaborate with each other when their workplace is under constant change and transformation.  

I show them the skills and behaviours to self-direct their learning to work smarter, not harder.  These skills set them for success to manage information overload; build reputation and expertise and build portable networks of collaborators who can help them in their work, projects and careers.

To me, learning AT WORK AND THROUGH WORK and WITH OTHERS  ANYTIME, ANYWHERE, ANYHOW are seamless.  I believe that when we work in an open and transparent manner, using tools that tap into a global network of people who can help us solve our organisational problems is a critical skill set for any knowledge worker.

I work with you through first UNDERSTANDING YOUR BUSINESS and then design and develop a custom SOCIAL LEARNING EXPERIENCE for your workforce to collaborate by using a blend of in person, virtual and social tools and technologies. Alternatively, I have a suite of different packaged courses to consider.

I love to learn, create and have a laugh. Community is important to me. I have a dream to connect people and businesses closer with their local communities through vibrant social networks and co-working spaces. When I'm not working, you'll find me knitting, reading, blogging and vlogging.

I also founded Third Place, a co-working and networking community of over 500 Learning Professionals across 6 Australian cities to meet, network, learn, co-work and share with each other for their professional and personal development.  You can see more about the events we hold at: www.meetup.com/Third-Place

To learn more about how I can help you or your business learn fast to work smarter not harder, 

Email: enquiries@activatelearning.com.au

Visit: www.activatelearning.com.au

Call: +61 (0) 438 884 730 (Australian Eastern Standard Time Zone)

Consultant with the Change Agents Worldwide, a co-operative helping organisations support their workforce through collaborative learning experiences within the workplace.

Change Agents Worldwide is a network of progressive and passionate professionals, specializing in Future of Work technologies and practices. Our members come together in Change Agents Worldwide to share their practice, to learn and to collaborate on projects. Our focus is helping others to create change that enables a better, more effective and more human Future of Work.

* Provide workshops, coaching and training services to corporate executives and their teams on how to use social media for professional and career development.  This includes using social tools to build professional networks, manage their online and professional identity online, build skill and expertise in using the right social media for the purpose of building learning strategies to help them in their career.

*Provide consulting, design and development of guided collaborative learning programs (webinars, workshops, individualised executive coaching packages) for clients focussed on building lifelong learning strategies and skills in their employees

Examples include Coca Cola Amatil's Work, Connect and Learn Program which is a 5 week guided social learning experience (cMOOC) for engineers and maintenance teams across Australia and New Zealand to increase workplace collaboration across sites, build digital skills and networks across the company and reduce duplication through the practice of sharing knowledge in communities of practice.

Another example is the design, development and roll out of "Becoming a Connected Lawyer" for Holding Redlich. The aim of the consulting and webinar was to explain and demonstrate the strategic, personal and professional value of how lawyers may build their influence and internal networks through social networking behaviour using Yammer. 

I have coached a variety of individuals who are in the process of career transition, career development or wanting to start their own business to create an social profile and build their reputation online on their particular knowledge and expertise.

With over 20 years corporate HR leadership experience in blue-chip multinational companies within Australia and in the Asia Pacific region, I understand the capital forces driving business and global markets. My roles learning over the last 20 years have culminated in me describing myself as a corporate online learning specialist with a broad range of learning experience both online and face-to-face: from instructional design and online or face-to-face content development, to full Learning Management System implementation, integration, advocacy and management.

Mihaela Carpo is a professional Mechanical Engineer with more than 8 years of practical and successful international experience in the Resources and Energy Industry. 

She is currently the Engineering Knowledge Manager responsible for management and deployment of engineering technical standards and best practices for WorleyParsons globally. This role requires interaction and stakeholder engagement with global engineering leadership networks that are responsible for over 14,000 staff across 120 offices in 50 countries. 

Previous to that, Mihaela worked as a Mechanical and Piping Engineer involved in engineering design, procurement and site construction support on various projects in Australia and Canada, most notably in Fort McMurray, the global hub of Oil Sands development in Alberta, Canada. Mihaela has worked on projects of varied size from $10M to $3.2B and complexity from small well-pad installation projects to world-class mega-projects.

Throughout her career, Mihaela has held various leadership roles in corporate social responsibility groups, such as the engineering graduate development organization, United Way campaign, Village of Hope development in Kenya, and the Melbourne Corporate Responsibility committee.

general.description:
Steve is an experienced business leader across the infrastructure and resources sectors in Asia Pacific and an accomplished member of public company global leadership teams.  Steve’s experience includes growing and running tier 1 consulting businesses in Australia and Asia and in the merger and acquisition of international businesses.
Most recently Steve was a member of the steering group that created the vision, strategy and implementation plan for the development of the Advisian business for the WorleyParsons Group.  He remains a member of the Global Advisian Leadership Team and is Managing Director for the APAC region.
In previous roles with GHD and Hyder (now Arcadis) Steve was responsible for transformation of businesses in Australia and Asia.  He led the acquisition and divestment of businesses to accelerate these outcomes.
Steve’s background in capital project development also brings insight over a wide range of projects in the transport, social infrastructure, utilities, property and oil & gas sectors. He has worked in the consulting field, with a semi-government authority and in an upstream hydrocarbons company, gaining experience in all aspects of the design, construction, and project management processes, from the feasibility assessment of a project through to construction.  He has particular experience in transport infrastructure, tunnels and in privately financed and design and build projects.
Steve has a deep understanding of all aspects of business management including marketing, human resources, operations and finance.  Most importantly Steve has proven his ability to lead teams to deliver outstanding results.

general.headline: CEO & Managing Partner, PwC Consulting in Australia, South East-Asia and New Zealand
general.description:
Neil Plumridge is the CEO & Managing Partner of PwC Consulting in Australia, South-East Asia and New Zealand (ASEANZ). A position that involves leading a diverse team of professionals across one of the most dynamic regions of the world, Neil works with a range of clients to build trust in society and solve important problems. A productivity and business transformation specialist, Neil assists clients in both the private and public sectors.

With a background of more than two decades in management consulting, Neil possesses significant domestic and international experience, having worked in over 20 cities around the globe. With experience in the telecommunications, media and entertainment, financial services, aviation, healthcare, utilities, natural resources and public sectors, Neil has led and worked on more than 150 projects, including teams of two to over 500 members.

Some of Neil’s past leadership roles have included Managing Partner of PwC Consulting in Australia, Managing Partner and Leader of the Oceania Advisory practice at Ernst & Young, and Vice President and Leader of the Asia-Pacific Telecommunications, Media and Entertainment practice at A.T. Kearney.

Holding an MBA from Emory University’s Goizueta Business School, Neil has also completed a Bachelor of Business at Swinburne University of Technology.

With more than 20 years of experience in management consultancy, Neil’s specialities lie in the areas of:
•	Cost Leadership
•	Productivity Improvement
•	Performance Improvement Program Design
•	Program Implementation
•	Business Strategy
•	Public Sector

jobs.jobTitle: CEO & Managing Partner, PwC Consulting in Australia, South East-Asia and New Zealand
jobs.description:
Neil heads up Consulting at PwC in ASEANZ (Australia, South-East and New Zealand).
      This position involves working with a range of clients to build trust in society and solve
      
      important problems in one of the most dynamic regions of the world.

Prior to joining PwC, Neil was with Ernst & Young – one of the Big Four global accounting firms, specialising in assurance, tax, transactions, consulting and advisory service provision. During his time with EY, Neil held a number of leadership roles and was the Oceania Business Advisory Services leader and the Melbourne Advisory leader.

As Managing Partner of Advisory, Neil led the Advisory Practice throughout Oceania (Australia, New Zealand and Fiji) with the purpose of improving client business performance and effectively managing business risks. This position involved consulting to a wide range of clients, in both the private and public sectors.

Vice President at A.T. Kearney – a global management consultancy with offices in over forty countries around the world – Neil was responsible for one of the firm’s largest clients in the region. As VP, Neil collaborated and developed solutions for clients; managed business development opportunities; was involved in the oversight of client performance and the monitoring of their productivity improvement; ensured that the firm adhered to relevant legislation and firm policies; and, was involved in the management and monitoring of risk.

schools.description: Neil completed his MBA at the Goizueta Business School (GBS). A School at Emory University, located in Atlanta, Georgia, U.S.A., the GBS opened its doors in 1919. Emory University is over 150 years old and is internationally recognised for its liberal arts colleges, graduate and professional schools, and leading health care system. With more than 14,500 students from across the U.S. and over 100 international nations, Emory University remains a leading educational institution.

Neil completed a Bachelor of Business at Swinburne – one of Australia’s leading educational institutions. Ranked in the Top 400 universities in the world by the Academic Ranking of World Universities, Swinburne was established in 1908; has three Melbourne campuses; and, has both higher education and vocational education / TAFE courses.

Theo is a partner at PwC Australia in the Enterprise Digital team. Theo helps companies to use technology to solve operational challenges in their tax and finance functions. Theo leads the development team within Enterprise Digital. In this capacity, Theo helps clients to adopt existing software to solve their problems or alternatively develops custom solutions for unique problems faced by clients.

With a background in corporate and international tax, Theo has worked extensively with multinational companies to solve challenges faced by them that intersect finance/tax and technology - delivering innovative client-focused initiatives. 

More recently, Theo was featured in the Australian Financial Review as one of PwC's 12 hybrids - http://www.afr.com/business/accounting/pwcs-new-hybrids-are-a-hot-commodity-20160210-gmqv7a.

general.headline: Chairman and CEO at Australian Business Students' Association
general.description:
Tom Ryan is a 19-year-old full-time university student, managing the innovation and entrepreneurship arm at a private equity firm, alongside former HSBC CFO Sachin Maharaj, while simultaneously leading multiple student organisations and playing key roles in several startups.

With an unmatched track record for someone of his age, Tom is an extremely diligent and mature young business leader who continues to leave an indent across multiple sectors. Tom is driven towards a career in financial services, seeking to align his career trajectory in areas ranging from change, project and risk management. Tom takes proactive ownership of his professional development through acquiring new skills, and forging strong networks. Tom is an agile thinker, who thrives in complex and fast paced environments by demonstrating an initiative to innovate and adapt, under volatile and uncertain circumstances.

general.headline: Partner @ PwC | Australian Mining Leader | Acc’ting & Finance | Director, The Good Foundation | MBA
general.school: University of Melbourne - Melbourne Business School
general.description:
Chris Dodd is a listed company auditor with responsibility for PwC's Consumer Assurance business and efforts to advance Australia's Future Prosperity. With almost three decades of experience in accounting and finance, Chris has been at PwC since 1990 and as Partner since 2003. He served for four years as Managing Partner of PwC’s Melbourne Office.

Having gained international experience during his time with PwC, Chris worked in the United Kingdom, Asia and Africa.

Throughout his time with PwC, Chris has assisted clients with everything from their core accounting and governance obligations, to working with the Board and Executive on their Change Agenda, integrating significant acquisitions, and responding under high pressure to asset closures, social media storms and responding to the Global Financial Crisis. 

From ASX50 Industry Leaders thru to renewable energy start-ups to his keen interest in sporting associations, such as Cricket Australia (including Big Bash setup and AB Medal counts), Richmond Football Club and AFL Coaches Association, Chris has assisted small businesses to the largest of mining companies.

On The Good Foundation’s Board of Directors and Chair of the Audit Committee, Chris is part of the organisation that delivers Jamie Oliver's Ministry of Food in Australia, with support from organisations such as The Good Guys and Woolworths. With an obvious link to quality female education, Chris is a member of the Finance Committee for Loreto Ministries Limited.

Chris holds a Masters of Business Administration from Melbourne Business School (Dean’s List) and a Bachelor of Commerce, majoring in accounting and business law, from the University of Melbourne. 

Specialities: With almost three decades of industry experience, Chris’ specialities lie in the areas of:
•	Problem Solving and Innovation
•	Financial Audits & Risk Management
•	Due Diligence 
•	Project Management
•	Infrastructure, Energy & Mining
•	Mass Customer, media and software
•	Sporting Sector

      Comalco, Alumina, WMC, RJB Coal, Billiton, Ballarat Goldfields, Cobar mines and Golden
      
      Shamrock.

Chris is an assurance partner on both listed and large multinational companies. This position involves assisting clients across a range of industries, including Energy & Mining, Infrastructure, Consumer, Media, Software and Renewables. His listed client base has included Transurban, Medibank Private, MMG, Southern Cross Media, MYOB, Alumina, Centro Properties, Novera Energy and CFC Ltd.

Chris joined PwC Australia in 1990. Since then, Chris has worked on a range of projects
      
      in Australia, the UK, Asia and Africa.

As Managing Partner for PwC Australia’s Melbourne Office, Chris managed PwC's efforts
      in the Melbourne business community, including events, affiliations and community
      impact. Chris leads, refines and evaluates the strategic plan; ensures objectives are
      
      being met; develops the office financial plan; and, evaluates and manages 

... See more

Chris is an Advisory Council Member of the Centre for Social Impact (CSI) – a four-university collaboration that aims to “improve the delivery of beneficial social impact in Australia through research, teaching, measurement and the promotion of public debate.” The University of New South Wales, Swinburne University of Technology, The University of Western Australia and The University of Melbourne make up the CSI. 

With Advisory Councils in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth, Chris is involved in providing independent advice, insight and guidance on key matters of importance to the CSI.

One of five Board Directors of The Good Foundation – a not-for-profit promoting good health and nutrition through the Jamie Oliver Ministry of Food and incorporating the values of practicality, sharing, integrity, quality & value and generosity – Chris is involved in determining the direction of The Foundation; ensuring that the objectives of the Foundation are being met; strategic plan development and oversight; ensuring that finances are on budget; and that records, finances and documents comply with regulations. Chris chairs the Audit Committee.

The Marian and EH Flack Trust – The Edwin Flack Trust – is independent philanthropic trust constituted in 1935 under the Will of the late Edwin Harold Flack. Edwin Flack was the Senior Partner of Flack & Flack Charted Accountants, in Australia, which later became Price Waterhouse, and in 1998 after a merger, became known as PricewaterhouseCoopers. The majority of Edwin Flack's estate was left in trust for charitable purposes, in perpetuity. Chris is a member of the Trust's Advisory Council.

The second oldest university in Australia, The University of Melbourne has a student population of 47,000; has over 100 research centres and institutes; has seven campuses across Victoria; and is ranked as the number one research university in Australia.

general.headline: Managing Partner @ PwC AU | Accountancy, Finance, Regulatory | Board Member & Chair, Advisory Committees
general.location: Spit Junction, New South Wales, Australia
general.description:
Joseph Carrozzi is a Managing Partner at PwC Australia. A Partner at PwC Australia for over 13 yrs, Joseph has focused on building strong client relationships and leading client service teams for some of Australia’s largest organisations, including ASX100s and government bodies.

A background that extends over two decades in the accounting profession, Joseph was also a Managing Partner at Ernst & Young and Arthur Andersen before joining PwC Australia. Throughout his career, Joseph has worked on projects in both the public and private sectors, with experience in infrastructure projects and asset financing in the water, rail, power, irrigation and services utilities sectors.

Joseph is Chair of the Italian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (ICCI) in Australia, Chair of the Sydney Harbour Federation Trust and Chair of the Centenary Institute for Medical Research. He is also Deputy Chairman of the GWS Giants.  Joseph is also a Board Member of the NSW Institute of Sport and the Western Sydney University. 

Holding a Bachelor of Commerce and Bachelor of Laws from the University of New South Wales, Joseph is admitted as a Barrister at Law in NSW. He is also a Member of the Chartered Accountants Australia and New Zealand and a Fellow of the Tax Institute of Australia (FTI). 

Specialities: With more than 20 years of experience in management consultancy, Joseph’s specialities lie in the areas of:
•	Accounting / Finance
•	Taxation
•	Mergers & Acquisitions
•	Business Strategy
•	Leadership

jobs.description:
Member of the Sydney Harbour Trust, a statutory authority enacted by the Federal
      government to preserve and manage several iconic harbour sites for the benefit of the
      
      general public

A Managing Partner at PwC Australia, Joseph is a member of the firms leadership team and leads, supports and develops business strategy and operations across the firm’s Cities Agenda. Our aim is to engage all our offices and teams to make a difference to the communities in which we operate - to make our cities more connected and prosperous. PwC in NSW has over 7,000  great staff members around the country.

Joseph joined PwC Australia in 2005. During his career, Joseph has provided
      consultancy to clients from both the public and private sectors, ASX100s and
      
      multinationals in the areas of taxation, infrastructure advisory and M&A.

jobs.companyName: Italian Chamber of Commerce and Industry in Australia
jobs.description:
Joseph is Chair of the Italian Chamber of Commerce & Industry, Sydney. Established in 1922 to promote and extend business relations between Australia and Italy, The Italian Chamber of Commerce supports trade and strengthens relationships between the two countries. It has assisted many businesses succeed in both countries. 

As Chair, Joseph provides leadership to the Board and its members; ensures governance so that the Board is able to carry out its full responsibilities and achieve its mission; manages Board administrative and operational activities; and, oversees Board effectiveness.

Joseph is a Board Member and Chair of the Audit & Risk Committee at the GWS Giants (The Greater Western Sydney Giants). The Giants is an AFL team formed in 2009 and represents both the Greater Western Sydney area and Canberra. 

As Board Member, Joseph is involved in setting the strategic direction of the Club; approves the strategic plan and budget; ensures that the Club is financially sound and that operations are ethical; and in accordance with the mission and charter of the AFL conduct codes in Australia. As Chair of the Audit & Risk Committee, Joseph ensures the Committee oversees its financial reporting obligations, performs effective risk management and fulfils disclosure obligations in compliance with both the Club’s policies and also legislative requirements.

After being a Board member since 2009, was appointed Chairman in May 2017 of The Centenary Institute  – an independent medical research institute, focusing on cancer, cardiovascular and infectious diseases in order to discover and bring to use novel therapeutics and diagnostics.  The Centenary is housed in the iconic  health precinct in Sydney with RPA & Sydney University. His focus is on building the brand of the Institute, securing funds for the important research work and ensuring that the Institute is able to grow and operate in a financially sustainable manner.

As a Member of the NSW Multicultural Business Advisory Panel, Joseph provides independent advice to the NSW Deputy Premier and Minister for Trade and Investment and Minister for Citizenship and Communities. This advice centres upon ways to promote NSW’s cultural diversity, language skills and international connections in order to develop business in the state of NSW.

A Member of the EABC Board – a not-for-profit entity established to connect business organisations and trade agencies in order to promote Australian-European trade and investment – Joseph  is involved in the development of the Council’s  objectives and strategic planning; ensuring that objectives are being met; overseeing financial matters; building relationships; and ensuring legal compliance.

Joseph is a Member of Athletics Australia’s Audit Committee. An independent advisory
      role, Joseph delivers expertise, advice, input and feedback to Athletics Australia in
      relation to financial matters, including operational and managerial, adherence to
      
      financial legislation; alignment with objectives; financial probity; and, governance.

Joseph was nominated to the Board of the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) Asian Cup 2015 by the NSW Government. The Asian Cup brings together countries from the Asian region every four years to compete and crown the Asian football champions. The competition in 2015 will occur over a one-month period in January 2015.

As Board Member, Joseph is involved in helping the Asian Cup achieve its mission and goals; establishing the project delivery program and risk management program so that the competition is not only a successful celebration of football in Asia but also leaves a legacy for the game in Australia. This objective involves ensuring financial viability through budgeting and financial oversight; monitoring the effectiveness of activities; promoting external relationships between the government, participating nations within the AFC; and building the game across the various communities in Australia.

Prior to joining PwC, Joseph was a Tax Partner at Ernst & Young – one of the Big Four
      global audit firms, specialising in assurance, tax, consulting and advisory services. He
      led the tax and legal practice of EY as National Managing Partner before then taking
      
      the role of Managing Partner Operations for the firm’s Eastern Region in Australia.

Prior to joining Ernst & Young, Joseph was a Tax Partner at Arthur Andersen – formerly one of the “Big Five” accounting firms, providing auditing, tax, and consultancy services. He started at Arthur Andersen as a graduate in 1987 and became a partner in 1994 in the tax and law practice.  He then became National Managing Partner Tax & Law in 1999, including serving on the Asia Pacific and Global tax management team.

schools.description: Joseph holds a Bachelor of Commerce and University of New South Wales – one of Australia’s leading universities. Ranked in the Top 60 universities worldwide, UNSW Australia is a founding member of the Group of Eight and has more than 50,000 students from across 120 countries. Joseph is admitted as a Barrister at Law in NSW.

My role in the Melbourne team will focus on: 
> business and asset valuations for transaction, financial reporting, tax and strategic decision making purposes

> intangible asset valuations and purchase price allocation exercises

jobs.jobTitle: Corporate Finance - Valuations, Manager to Senior Manager
jobs.description:
I spent more than 2.5 years in the PwC Zurich Deals team on an international secondment where I focused on Valuation and Transaction consulting support. 

My experience in Zurich included: 
> working with Holcim and Lafarge for 18+ months on numerous aspects of their merger in three key roles: 
(i) approximately 6 months sell-side transaction support to local operating company managements preparing business plan and forecasting models 
(ii) approximately 6 months in a Project Management role responsible for managing the investor Q&A process for more than 25 bidders in regards of the EUR 6 billion divestment package
(iii) approximately 6 months assisting the new LafargeHolcim management preparing the purchase price allocation for the combined entity.

> preparing a business plan model, scenario-based analysis and business plan documentation for a live agricultural start-up to support capital raising activities and existing shareholder investment decisions

> performing purchase price allocations for clients in the pharmaceuticals and telecommunications industries.   

More broadly, my Swiss experience also included:
- fair market business valuations for financial reporting and taxation purposes
- intangible asset valuations (as part of purchase price allocations, valuations to determine economically appropriate royalty rates etc.) 
- business planning services (development of 3-way integrated financial models and / or accompanying business plan documents).

general.headline: Group Managing Director at Slater and Gordon
general.description:
Andrew joined Slater & Gordon in 1994, and has worked as a lawyer in most litigation practice areas, before becoming Managing Director in 2000.  Andrew has been instrumental in implementing Slater & Gordon's growth strategy to create a leading international consumer law firm employing 1,250 people in 70 locations in Australia and 1,300 people in 13 locations in the United Kingdom. 

Andrew has been at the forefront of the successful acquisition and integration of more than 39 law firms including six in the UK where Slater & Gordon is driving the consolidation of the UK consumer legal services market.  He has also successfully diversified the firm's service offering into targeted areas of consumer law such as Family Law and Conveyancing and led continual innovation towards the achievement of Slater & Gordon’s goal of making legal services accessible and affordable. 

Andrew served as the founding chair of the Youth Junction Inc, a not for profit youth charity operating in Victoria and remains a member of its voluntary board.  Andrew is also a member of the Advisory Council of the Melbourne Law School (University of Melbourne).

Andrew’s contribution to the legal industry has been recognised over the years with awards such as the Lawyers Weekly Managing Partner of the Year Award in 2011 and the American Lawyers Magazine’s Innovators Award in 2013.

Andrew celebrated his 20th Anniversary at Slater & Gordon on 11 April 2014.

•	Global Telco/ ICT organisation: Multiple projects including support of Agile ways of working, a major customer centric culture transformation, creation of a new organisation structure and integration approach for two divisions, off-shoring change project, creation of a cross enterprise leadership programme, creation of a customer centricity culture program

AchieveGlobal is an international business consultancy focused on improving business results for clients by operationalising their strategies through alignment and improvement of the attitudes, behaviours and skills of people.

general.headline: General Manager VIC at HR Partners a Randstad Company
general.description:
HR Candidates - Looking for your next HR role?  Looking at what drives and inspires you?
HR Clients - Looking for the right HR person for your organisation?
HR people - Happily in HR – but feeling like you need to get connected to the rest of the HR world – meet other HR Professionals, see what else is going on ‘out there’, in best practice or other industries?
Feel free to connect on (03) 8621 5700 or here on LinkedIn.

I love the privilege of getting to know amazing HR professionals, your story, successes (and how you did it), future aspirations, and where you are at in life.  
I understand that a job is more than just a job – a career can shape a life.

My background
Anita Vaughan – is back with energy and passion, having returned from maternity leave, to join Sue Ritchie at HR Partners Digby Morgan as General Manager Victoria.  Anita partners with HR professionals and organisations to create a unique fit for achieving business and individual success.  With 12 years on the ground experience in both HR and Recruitment functions within commercial organisations, she has developed her ability to see, question and identify key distinctions that create great business and personal outcomes for both parties.  Her life long curiosity and knowledge of what drives, inspires and moves people, to create success for themselves and organisations, continues to give Anita an edge in what she does.  

Anita’s combination of solid recruitment and selection expertise and HR generalist experience enables her to understand the intricacies of the HR profession.  She brings with her; knowledge, energy, a passion for career coaching, as well as authentically wanting to make a difference. Anita’s passion and style is centered around being authentic in her interactions, instilling confidence in her audience, and prides herself on getting a detailed analysis on client and candidate background to ensure a professional solution that meets individual, cultural and business needs.

general.headline: Associate Director, Institute of Positive Education, Geelong Grammar School
general.description:
With its stated vision of assisting schools around the world ‘to place wellbeing at the heart of education’ Geelong Grammar School’s Institute of Positive Education is an exciting and ambitious organisation, passionate about the nurturing and elevating the wellbeing of school communities. For the last ten years, the Institute has pioneered in Positive Education; the evidence-based, whole-school approach to wellbeing that has been implemented in hundreds of schools around the world.

As Associate Director of the Institute, it is my job to help educators, schools, organisations and governments around the world to share in what we have learned about the transformative possibilities of Positive Education. 

Our team of 20 has now supported over 1,000 educational institutions with their wellbeing journeys and I am so excited about the small but fundamentally important contribution we are continuing to make to the evolution of education globally.

If you are interested in learning more about how the best schools in the world are successfully placing wellbeing at the heart of education, I’d love to chat.

https://www.ggs.vic.edu.au/institute

With a focus on creating positive mental health and equitable education in all primary and secondary schools, The Positive Schools conferences have been heralded as the most prestigious wellbeing and positive education conference series in the world today.  

Join us for three days of unmissable presentations.
Brisbane Convention Centre 16-17-18 May
Rydges Esplanade Hotel, Fremantle 23-24-25 May
Melbourne Convention Centre 30-31 may 1st June
Central Sydney 6-7-8. June

general.headline: Head of Positive Education & Senior School Psychologist
general.description:
I'm fascinated by humans; how we learn, feel, think and perform.  I am particularly interested in how we can bring the best out in ourselves and others, and the central roles of finding joy and purpose.

A current project is looking at ways we can gain insight by combining data on wellbeing, achievement, and associated measures, such as absences; and turning this insight into effective intervention in collaboration with leaders, the staff they serve and clients (/students).

I've been fortunate to have experience as a psychologist / middle leader / corporate coach, to have presented at schools and conferences around Australia, and to have had some of my research on wellbeing, social connection and sleep quality published in the International Journal of Social Psychiatry and elsewhere. 

For any more info, drop me a line, or have a look at www.nahumkozak.com.

general.headline: Director of Professional Practice & Ravenswood Institute
general.description:
With international teaching experience, Andrea has a global perspective on education and an appreciation for diversity. Credentialed in Washington and California, she is also qualified by NESA (K-6). Andrea has a Master of Education that focused on Primary Mathematics and a Graduate Certificate in Gifted Education. Her role incorporates coaching leaders and educators, establishing and implementing a framework for professional learning, teacher accreditation and developing the Ravenswood Institute. Andrea believes that an educator's professional learning should be personalised and empowering and is interested in educational research. She is on the editorial board of School Leadership & Management Journal and is a member of the NSW Australian Council for Educational Leaders  (ACEL) executive committee.

Andrea was awarded the Keith Tronc Award for the most outstanding teacher from ACEL. She received a fellowship from Wenona School and completed the 'Art of Leadership'​ at Harvard University in Boston. Andrea's active involvement in the TeachMeet movement and being co-moderator of #satchatOC and #EduCoachOC provided her with the opportunity to connect with local and international professionals. Andrea proposes that social media provides opportunities for learning and opens dialogue to views and ideas that are not confined by specific contexts or circumstances. 

BGenStuds/BTeach, GradCertEdStud, MEd, GradCertGiftedEd

general.headline: Education Consultant: Australian Council for Educational Research
general.description:
As an educator for over thirty years there have been the positives and negatives and definitely the 'interesting' when it has come down to collaborating and working with students, teachers, school services officers, leaders and many of the experts in their fields.
I've had the opportunity to be a leader, consultant, educator and mentor in a number of capacities. This had only encouraged me to find out more about what it is to be a 'learner' and not just a teacher. Therefore, as I embark on a new direction as an Education Consultant with the Australian Council for Educational Research - ACER - I continue to learn more about the learning.

"The teacher is the one who gets the most out of the lessons, and the true teacher is the learner"
Elbert Hubbard - American editor/publisher 1856-1915

jobs.description:
As an education consultant I have the opportunity and the privilege to work alongside teaching staff, support staff, consultants and leaders. I am able to listen and discuss with them the journey they have taken and the paths they want and need to take into learning that will impact on students and their growth and development as life-long learners. I facilitate workshops that support both paper and online assessment with PAT (Progressive Achievement Tests), help staffs to navigate current and newly developed resources to support intervention, class practices, formative and summative assessment and differential instruction. ACER research resources allow teachers to continue to develop and build upon pedagogy.
I am able to work with schools across South Australia but connect with schools across Australia and beyond. I collaborate with all Government, Catholic and Independent Schools. I share and distribute resources and information to best support schools and staffs as they work towards a common goal: the best outcomes for all students in their care.

Classroom teacher: I have worked with students from Pre School to Year 10.
Mentor: Support pre-service teachers, graduates and peer teachers an all aspects of teaching and learning.

general.headline: Chief Executive Officer at Unity Grammar
general.description:
Aaron Boyd is currently Chief Executive Officer at Unity Grammar, Sydney, Australia. His key areas of responsibility include the strategic leadership and management of the College vision, strategic planning, quality teaching and learning, academic standards, wellbeing, business development, finance, human resources, professional development, marketing, fundraising, public relations, stakeholder engagement, knowledge management, technology, systems, policies and procedures, legal and risk management, change management, project management, facility and asset management, and developing a culture of innovation. 

Aaron's passion is to be challenged in all aspects of life - at work, on the sporting field or pursuing a range of hobbies. He enjoys strategic planning and has a reputation for achieving objectives effectively and efficiently.

Aaron has worked extensively in Government and Independent educational institutions as a Teacher, Head of Department, Curriculum Consultant, Director of Administration, Dean of Studies, Head of Programs & Operations, and Chief Operating Officer (COO) for over 25 years. He received his MBA from the University of Wollongong, MEd from the University of Sydney and BEd from ACPE. Aaron is also a Justice of the Peace.

Aaron is a published author of a range of textbooks and teaching resources with McGraw-Hill, Titan and Nelson-Cengage publishing companies. He has been an HSC Marker for over 21 years, which culminated in the role of Supervisor of Marking for PDHPE, where he is responsible for the statewide marking process in NSW for over 15,000 students completing the PDHPE HSC examination. Aaron is also a recipient of the NSW Premier and Australian College of Educators Award for Quality Teaching.

general.headline: High Performance Teams Expert & Workplace Psychologist
general.description:
Did you know that High Performance Teams are the ultimate competitive advantage in business as well as the foundations of all successful schools?  Dr Pete Stebbins, PhD is Australia’s leading expert on High Performance Teams in Education and Director of the High Performance Schools Project.

Prof John Hattie said: "Accomplishing the maximum impact on student learning depends on teams of teachers working together…".   Pete's big goal is to ensure that 'every team in every school across Australia is a High Performance Team!'

Over the last 3 years, Pete has worked with 938 education leaders across 179 schools supporting 4554 teaching and non-teaching staff implementing the High Performance Teams Program. Results show significant improvements in staff and student outcomes within 12 months, fast-tracking change that previously took 4-5 years! Shortening the change journey dramatically improves the lives of both students and staff.

With over 20 years experience, Pete is an enthusiastic facilitator, keynote speaker, guest psychologist on Channel 7 and executive coach. Pete is also a published researcher and author of books on leadership, change, resilience and teams including the best seller “iTeams: Why High Performance Teams ‘Fit In’ AND ‘Stand Out’".

Programs:
The High Performance Schools Leadership Team Development Program
High Performance Teams Program for Hospital & Health Services
HPT Workplace Practitioner Training

Clients:
Education Queensland Schools in CQ Region, DDSW Region, FNQ Region, SE Region & North Coast,  St Andrews Anglican College, University of Southern Queensland, Catholic Education,  Wide Bay HHS & Central Queensland HHS.

“The High Performance Teams Program that Pete runs has enabled my school to have a clear vision and set of actions for moving from good to great.  I can't recommend the program highly enough.” Kurt Goodwin, Principal Mt Archer State School

Contact Pete's Office
E: admin@HPTschools.com
Call: +61 408 107 586

As Director of  the High Performance Schools Project, over the last 3 years, Pete and his team have worked with 938 education leaders across 179 schools supporting 4554 teaching and non-teaching staff implementing the High Performance Teams Program.
